com.msgroup.moviesurfer.controller

Class MovieController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.msgroup.moviesurfer.controller.MovieController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/api")
public class MovieController
extends java.lang.Object
    MovieController handles the http requests to add edit or remove movies

    • Method Detail

      • addMovie

        @PostMapping(value="/addmovie")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addMovie(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                                           @Valid Movie movie,
                                                                                           org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        addMovie receives http post request from the client to add a movie. // @valid to pass a valid request body of type Movie ,so if an empty request body passed it will response with a status of 404. BindingResult analyzes the Movie object and checks weather or not there are errors for example: blank title. BindingResult will return a list of the detected errors List. ResponseEntity: question mark is for a generic type. ResponseEntity represents the whole HTTP response: status code, headers, and body. Used to fully configure the HTTP response.
        Parameters:
        movie - (movie object)
        result - (a list of detected errors )
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity

      • getMovies

        @GetMapping(value="/movies")
public java.util.List<Movie> getMovies()
        To get all movies, it could be an empty list if there is no movies
        Returns:
        list of movies

      • deleteMovie

        @DeleteMapping(value="/movies/delete/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteMovie(@PathVariable
                                                                                                          java.lang.Long id)
        To delete a movie by id
        Parameters:
        id - (movie's id)
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity of type String
